</strong><strong>继承</strong><strong>大笔遗产</strong><br />\r\n<strong>succeed with the public&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>大受公众欢迎</strong><br />\r\n<strong>21. comment&nbsp; n.</strong><strong>意见、评论、批评</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>vi.</strong><strong>评论、发表意见</strong><br />\r\n<strong>without comment </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>不加评论</strong><br />\r\n<strong>a matter of comment </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>评论的话题</strong><br />\r\n<strong>comment on / upon sth.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>make comment</strong><strong>s </strong><strong>about / on sth.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>22. visa&nbsp; n.</strong><strong>签证</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>vt.</strong><strong>在（护照上）背签，签准</strong><br />\r\n<strong>be granted an entrance entry (exit) visa&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>被给予入境（出境）签证</strong><br />\r\n<strong>visa a passport&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>签准护照</strong><br />\r\n<strong>get / have </strong><strong>one&rsquo;s passport visaed</strong><strong>取得护照签证</strong><br />\r\n<strong>23. parallel adj.</strong><strong>平行的、相同的、类似</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>vt.</strong><strong>使</strong><strong>平行，与&hellip;&hellip;平行，比得上</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; adv. </strong><strong>平行地</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp; be </strong><strong>parallel to / with&hellip;</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp; <strong>be </strong><strong>parallel to&hellip;</strong><br />\r\n<strong>24.abundant&nbsp; adj.</strong><strong>丰富的、充裕的</strong><br />\r\n<strong>be abundant / rich in&hellip;</strong><br />\r\n<strong>e.g Our province is abundant / rich in minerals.&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>我省矿产丰富。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>abundant / plentiful&nbsp; </strong><strong>辨析</strong><strong>:</strong><br />\r\n<strong>abundant</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>指人、鱼、鸟、雨水等的量大。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>plentiful </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>指量方面的丰富，特指食物，水等事物。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>The forest is abundant in birds.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><br />\r\n<strong>这片森林里的鸟很多。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>a plentiful supply of food&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>充裕的</strong><strong>食品供应</strong><br />\r\n<strong>abundance&nbsp; n.</strong><strong>大量、充足、丰富</strong><br />\r\n<strong>grain in abundance </strong>&nbsp;<strong>充足的粮食</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>an abundance of sunshine </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;<strong>充足的阳光</strong><br />\r\n<strong>25.govern&nbsp;&nbsp; v. </strong><strong>统治、支配、管理</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<strong>&nbsp;government </strong><strong>n.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>26.settle in </strong><strong>安顿下来</strong><br />\r\n<strong>适应新环境</strong><strong>/</strong><strong>新工作</strong> &nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;settle down </strong><strong>定居，</strong><br />\r\n<strong>（使）平静下来</strong><br />\r\n<strong>settle on</strong><strong>决定</strong><br />\r\n<strong>settle&nbsp; vt. </strong><strong>安排，整理，</strong><strong>使定居，使平静，</strong><br />\r\n<strong>解决，决定</strong><br />\r\n<strong>vi.</strong> <strong>停留，下沉，</strong><strong>平定下来，定居</strong><br />\r\n<strong>重点句型：</strong><br />\r\n<strong>Warming up , Pre-reading&nbsp; and&nbsp; Reading</strong><strong>：</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n<ol>\r\n	<li>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>What do you think she will find different </strong></span></li>\r\n</ol>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>from studying at a Chinese school / </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>university ?</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>你认为她将发现什么与在中国学校或大学</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>中的学习不同</strong><strong>?</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>此句是一个特殊的复杂疑问句</strong><strong>,</strong><strong>结构：特殊疑</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>问词</strong><strong>+</strong><strong>一般疑问句（插入语）</strong><strong>+</strong><strong>陈述句</strong><strong>。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>适用于以上插入语的常用动词有</strong><strong>:</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>think,&nbsp; believe, &nbsp;suppose, imagine,&nbsp; guess, </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>consider, suggest, say</strong><strong>等。</strong><strong>例如：</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>Where do you suggest we spend our holiday?</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>你建议我们去哪里度假？</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n<ol>\r\n	<li value=\"2\">\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>It was the first time she had ever left her </strong></span></li>\r\n</ol>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>home country</strong><strong>。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>这是她第一次离开自己的祖国。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n<ul>\r\n	<li>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>It /This /That </strong><strong>is</strong><strong> the first (second&middot;&middot;&middot;) time </strong></span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>(that) sb.</strong><strong> have/has done </strong><strong>sth.&nbsp; </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>某人第一次（第二次</strong><strong>&middot;&middot;&middot;</strong><strong>）做某事</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>②</strong><strong>It/This/That</strong><strong> was </strong><strong>the first (second&middot;&middot;&middot;) time </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>(that) sb. </strong><strong>had done</strong><strong> sth.&nbsp; </strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>某人第一次（第二次</strong><strong>&middot;&middot;&middot;</strong><strong>）做了某事</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>③</strong><strong>It/This/That </strong><strong>will be</strong><strong> the first (second&middot;&middot;&middot;) time </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>(that) sb.</strong><strong> have/has done</strong><strong> sth.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>某人将一次（第二次</strong><strong>&middot;&middot;&middot;</strong><strong>）做某事</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>It&rsquo;s&nbsp; time&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (that) sb. did /should do sth.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>It&rsquo;s high time&nbsp; (that) sb. did /should do sth.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>It&rsquo;s about time (that) sb. did /should do&nbsp; sth.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>=It&rsquo;s (high / about) time (for sb.) to do sth.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>是某人该做某事的时候了</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>3.&middot;&middot;&middot;because I didn&rsquo;t know what to expect.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>疑问词</strong><strong>+to do </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>①</strong><strong>When to start</strong><strong> has not been decided. </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>何时动身尚未决定。（主语）</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n<ul>\r\n	<li>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>I don&rsquo;t know what to do. </strong></span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>我不知道该怎么办。</strong><strong>（宾语）</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>③</strong><strong>The difficulty was how to cross the river. </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>困难在于如何过河。（表语）</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n<ul>\r\n	<li>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>I can tell you where to get this book. </strong></span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>我可以告诉你在哪里可以买到此书。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>（双重宾语）</strong><br />\r\n<strong>相关连接</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>(1)</strong><strong>有时疑问词前可用介词。例如：</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>e.g I have no idea of how to do it.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>我不知道如何做这件事。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>(2)</strong><strong>动词</strong><strong>know</strong><strong>后面不能直接跟不定式做宾</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>语，只能用</strong><strong>&ldquo;know + </strong><strong>疑问词</strong><strong> +</strong><strong>不定式</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><strong>。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>e.g&nbsp; I have no idea of how to do it.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>=</strong><strong> I don&rsquo;t know how to do it.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>4.Studying here is quite different from </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>studying in China and you need some </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>preparation first, either here or in China.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>在这儿学习与在中国学习完全不同，你需要</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>首先作一些准备，要么在这儿准备，要么在</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>中国准备。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>either here or in China </strong><strong>是由</strong><strong>either&hellip;or&hellip;</strong><strong>连</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>接的地点状语。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>either&hellip;or</strong><strong>的句法功能：</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>作为并列连词，</strong><strong>either&hellip;or</strong><strong>一般用来连接句</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>子中的同等成分，如名词、动词、介词短</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>语、分句等。但有时也可见到前后不一致</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>的情况。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<strong>①</strong><strong>I will take either Japanese or Korean as my second foreign language.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>我要么选日语要么选韩语作为我的第二外语。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>②</strong><strong>Sorrow and trouble either soften the heart </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>or </strong><strong>harden it.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>悲哀和烦恼不是使人心软，就是使人心狠。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>③</strong><strong>Either</strong><strong> come in or go out .</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>要么</strong><strong>进来，要么出去。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>④</strong><strong>Either</strong><strong> you are mad, or I am .</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>要么</strong><strong>你疯了，要么我疯了。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>值得注意的是，</strong><strong>either&hellip;or&hellip;</strong><strong>在连接并列分</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>句时又可是表示隐含的否定条件。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>例如：</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>You&rsquo;ll either behave yourself, or you&rsquo;ll never </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>go out with me again.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>你得规矩点，要不就别再想和我一起出去。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>（比较：</strong><strong>Behave yourself, or you&rsquo;ll never go </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>out with me again.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>=If you don&rsquo;t behave yourself ,you&rsquo;ll never go </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>out with me again.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>5.take up </strong><strong>占据</strong><strong>(</strong><strong>时间或空间</strong><strong>),</strong><strong>拿起，从事，</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>对</strong><strong>&middot;&middot;&middot;</strong><strong>有兴趣，继续，重新开始</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>6. feel like (doing) sth. </strong><strong>摸上去如同，</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>想要，觉得好似</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>Do you feel like (having) a walk with me?</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>跟我一道去散散步怎么样？</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>7.When I got /was lost and had to ask a </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>passer-by for</strong><strong> directions, I didn&rsquo;t always </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>understand.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>（</strong><strong>1</strong><strong>）</strong><strong>get lost </strong><strong>是由</strong><strong>&ldquo;get+</strong><strong>过去分词</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><strong>构成的短</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>语，类似的还有：</strong><strong>get excited (married, </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>hurt, paid ,dressed ,drunk, separated&middot;&middot;&middot;)</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>（</strong><strong>2</strong><strong>）</strong><strong>passer-by </strong><strong>是个合成词，意为&ldquo;过路人&rdquo;</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>复数形式</strong><strong>passer</strong><strong>s</strong><strong>-by</strong><strong> by-passers&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>类似的词还有</strong><strong>looker-on&nbsp; </strong><strong>意为&ldquo;旁观者&rdquo;</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>复数形式</strong><strong>looker</strong><strong>s</strong><strong>-on</strong><strong>或</strong><strong>on-looker</strong><strong>s</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>（</strong><strong>3</strong><strong>）部分否定</strong><strong> I didn&rsquo;t always understand</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>He does not always play volleyball.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>他并不是老打排球。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>All</strong><strong> that glitters is not gold.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>发亮的东西并不一定都是金子。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>Not every</strong><strong> man is honest.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>并不是每个人都诚实。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>要点归纳</strong><br />\r\n<strong>all, both, each, every everybody, everything, </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>complete, completely, always, whole, wholly, </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>entirely, altogether</strong><strong>等具有总括意义的代词、</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>形容词和副词与</strong><strong>not, no</strong><strong>等否定词连用，构</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>成部分否定，表示</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>不都、并非都</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><strong>。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>全部否定：</strong><strong>no, none, never, nobody, nothing, </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>neither, no one, nowhere, no more, </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>no longer, no way</strong><strong>等表示否定意义</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>的词与肯定式谓语使用构成</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>全部否定</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><strong>。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>例如：</strong></span><br />\r\n<ul>\r\n	<li>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>Nobody agrees with you.</strong></span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>没有人会同意你。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\r\n<ul>\r\n	<li>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>Neither answer is correct .</strong></span></li>\r\n</ul>\r\n<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>两种答案都不对。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>③</strong><strong>My pen is nowhere to be found.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>我的笔到处都找不到。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>8.live with&nbsp; </strong><strong>与</strong><strong>&middot;&middot;&middot;</strong><strong>一起生活，忍受，忍耐，</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>学会适应，接受</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>9.board with English families </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>寄宿在英国人的家中</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>board with a friend </strong><strong>在朋友家里搭伙</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>board in </strong><strong>在住宿处搭伙</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>board out </strong><strong>在外搭伙</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>10. hand in </strong><strong>交上，交纳</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>hand down </strong><strong>把</strong><strong>...</strong><strong>传下去</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>hand out </strong><strong>分发</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>hand over </strong><strong>移交</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>11. refer to </strong><strong>①</strong><strong>参考，查阅</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>②</strong><strong>提到，谈到，涉及，有关</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>③</strong><strong>指的是</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>refer to the dictionary </strong><strong>查字典</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>=look up sth. in the dictionary</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>12. She deserves to succeed.</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>deserve</strong><strong>：</strong><strong>be worthy of, be fit for </strong><strong>值得，应受</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>e.g&nbsp; Good work deserves good pay. </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>干得好应该得到好的报酬。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>13. a (wide, great) variety of </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>各种各样的，品类繁多的</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>various </strong><strong>adj.</strong><strong>不同的，各种各样的</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>all kinds of </strong><strong>各种各样的</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>vary v.</strong><strong>使</strong><strong>...</strong><strong>不同</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>for various reasons </strong><strong>因为种种理由</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>lack variety </strong><strong>缺乏多样性</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;</span><br />\r\n','','','221.1.213.194');

INSERT INTO `dede_cwez_addonarticle` VALUES('977','37','<div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">在我们的生活和学习中，与人合作是非常重要的。请你根据下表中所提供的信息，写一篇题为 &ldquo;Cooperate with others&rdquo;的英文演讲稿。请写在答题纸相应横线上。<br />\r\n		　　为何与人合作 可以高效地完成任务；<br />\r\n		　　可以节省时间和精力；<br />\r\n		　　可以从合作者身上学到很多。<br />\r\n		　　与谁合作 与喜欢的人合作 心情愉快，一起分享工作中的快乐和痛苦。<br />\r\n		　　 与不喜欢的人<br />\r\n		　　合作 能挑战自己与他人相处的能力。此外，关注工作比关注合作者本人更重要。日久，也许会发现他是一个很好相处的人。<br />\r\n		　　怎样做一个好的合作者 请你发表自己的观点&hellip;&hellip;（至少2点看法）<br />\r\n		　　注意：<br />\r\n		　　1．对所给要点，逐一陈述，适当发挥，不要简单翻译。 2．词数150左右。<br />\r\n		<br />\r\n		<br />\r\n		<br />\r\n		<br />\r\n		Good afternoon, everyone!<br />\r\n		The topic of my speech today is &ldquo;Cooperate with others&rdquo;.<br />\r\n		In this busy, modern world, if we want to complete our work effectively and efficiently, we must all learn to cooperate with others. If we lose our partner, then we will fail. Cooperation can save us a lot of time and energy. Additionally, we can learn much from our partners by cooperating them.<br />\r\n		When we cooperate with someone we like, we will feel very happy. And we can share our pleasure and sadness with him. But it can be difficult to be cooperative with someone we dislike. In such a situation, we may focus on our work, instead of our partner. Perhaps in working together with him for a long time, we&rsquo;ll learn that he is a man to get along well with. Even if this doesn&rsquo;t happen, it&rsquo;s still worth a try.<br />\r\n		How can we become a good partner? In my opinion,firstly,we should try to listen to others&rsquo; opinions. Secondly,if he makes mistakes, we also try to point them out. Thirdly, we mustn&rsquo;t beat others to make them in unfavorable position.<br />\r\n		Thank you for your listening!</span></div>\r\n</div>\r\n<br />\r\n<br />\r\n','','','221.1.213.194');
INSERT INTO `dede_cwez_addonarticle` VALUES('978','37','<div>\r\n	<div>\r\n		<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong><br />\r\n		教学 重点：1. doing的形式：doing; being done<br />\r\n		&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;2. doing做主语，表语和宾语。<br />\r\n		&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;3. doing与to do在动词后面做宾语的区别<br />\r\n		Step1 知识总结归纳：<br />\r\n		（一）动词ing形式起名词作用，在语法中也称做动名词．在句中做主语，宾语，表语和定语。它的基本形式有doing; being done。<br />\r\n		例句：<br />\r\n		1. Parking is difficult in the shopping center of the city.<br />\r\n		2. My favorite job is teaching English.<br />\r\n		3. His main hobby is collecting stamps.<br />\r\n		4. Denying this will be shutting one&rsquo;s eyes to fact.<br />\r\n		5. I suggest you should practise speaking English whenever you can.<br />\r\n		6. Hearing what I said, he couldn&rsquo;t help laughing.<br />\r\n		7. Did you see that car being repaired ?<br />\r\n		<strong>注：</strong>to do形式也可以做主语或表语。一般情况下，这两种形式做主语或表语，差别不是很大。但是如果刻意强调某个具体的动作，就用to do 形式， 而要表示一般性或泛指的动作则用doing形式。<br />\r\n		例如：<br />\r\n		1. It is difficult to park in the shopping center at the weekend.<br />\r\n		2. My duty is to take care of the baby while she is out.<br />\r\n		&nbsp;<br />\r\n		（二）在一些动词后面只能接动名词做宾语。后面跟doing做宾语的常见动词有：admit; advise; appreciate; avoid; complete; consider; deny; mention; mind; miss; prevent; delay; enjoy; escape; imagine; postpone; practise; risk; suggest;常见的动名词短语，如：be worth doing; can&rsquo;t help doing; look forward to doing; go on doing; insist on doing; prefer doing to doing; be busy doing; keep on doing; devote&hellip;to doing; spend&hellip;in doing; have difficulty in doing; have a good time doing; prevent&hellip;from doing<br />\r\n		1. I am looking forward to hearing from you soon.<br />\r\n		2. He has devoted himself to protecting the wildlife.<br />\r\n		3. He is trying to avoid answering my question.<br />\r\n		4. The accused man denied ever having met her.<br />\r\n		5. He insisted on sending for doctor at once.<br />\r\n		6. The film is well worth seeing.<br />\r\n		7. You can&rsquo;t imagine the difficulty we had making a little money.<br />\r\n		&nbsp;<br />\r\n		（三）doing形式的逻辑主语：当强调doing所表达的动作的执行者（逻辑主语）时，需要在doing前面加上物主代词，人称代词宾格，名词所有格或不定代词<br />\r\n		例句：<br />\r\n		1. I&rsquo;m surprised at your/you doing it.<br />\r\n		2. She insisted on their both accepting the invitation.<br />\r\n		3. Do you mind my opening the window ?<br />\r\n		4. Your being right doesn&rsquo;t necessarily mean my being wrong.<br />\r\n		5. The children are looking forward to spring coming.<br />\r\n		6. He disapproved of that being said about Jane.<br />\r\n		7. Mr. Carson complained about Tom and Mary coming to class late.<br />\r\n		&nbsp;<br />\r\n		（四）doing与to do在动词后面做宾语的区别:<br />\r\n		remember/forget to do：记住/忘记了去做某事<br />\r\n		Don&rsquo;t forget to do sth.=remember to do sth.<br />\r\n		regret to do: 遗憾地去做/说&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; regret doing: 后悔做了某事<br />\r\n		mean to do= want to do&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; mean doing 意味着做<br />\r\n		stop to do: 停下来去做&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; stop doing 停止/不去做<br />\r\n		try to do: 试图/努力/企图去做&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; try doing:&nbsp; 尝试用一种方法做<br />\r\n		go on to do 接着去做另一件事&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; go on doing: 继续把事情做下去<br />\r\n		例句：<br />\r\n		1. Don&rsquo;t forget to mail this letter tomorrow morning.<br />\r\n		2. I don&rsquo;t remember having said anything of the sort.<br />\r\n		3. I regret to say that you have failed in the exam.<br />\r\n		4. He tried to walk without a crutch.<br />\r\n		5. He went on to tell us about the accident.<br />\r\n		&nbsp;<br />\r\n		<strong>STEP2 【典型例题】</strong><br />\r\n		一. 单项选择：<br />\r\n		1. While shopping, people sometimes can&rsquo;t help ____ into buy something they don&rsquo;t really need.<br />\r\n		A. to persuade&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. persuading&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. being persuaded&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. be persuaded<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>题意为：进店购物，人们有时不得不被购买不想买的东西。can&rsquo;t help doing 不得不，禁不住做某事。主语people与persuade为被动关系，所以应用being done。<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>C<br />\r\n		2. In some parts of London, missing a bus means ____ for another hour.<br />\r\n		&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A. waiting&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. to wait&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. wait&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. to be waiting<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>根据句意：错过一班车意味着要再等上一个小时。意味着作某事：mean doing。<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>A<br />\r\n		3. How many of us_____, say, a meeting that is not important to us would be interested in the discussion?<br />\r\n		&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A. attended&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. attending&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. to attend&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. have attended<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>根据句意：比如说，我们当中参加一个对我们毫不重要的会议的人会有多少人对这个讨论感兴趣呢？us_____, say, a meeting that is not important to us作为动名词短语做of的宾语。<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>B<br />\r\n		4. &mdash;What should I do with this passage ?<br />\r\n		&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&mdash;___ the main idea of each paragraph.<br />\r\n		A. Finding out&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. Found out&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. Find out&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. To find out<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>问句中should用与征求建议，答语中应当是祈使句语气提出要求。<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>C<br />\r\n		5. I can&rsquo;t understand ___ her like that.<br />\r\n		A. you treat&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B, you to treat&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. why treat&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. you treating<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>understand后面接动名词做宾语.you为动名词treating的逻辑主语。　　<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>D<br />\r\n		6. He got well-prepared for the job interview, for he couldn&rsquo;t risk __ the good opportunity.<br />\r\n		&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; A. to lose&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. losing&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. to be lost&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. being lost<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>risk后面跟动名词做宾语。&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>B<br />\r\n		&nbsp;<br />\r\n		二. 短文改错：<br />\r\n		1. Shake her head, she said, &ldquo; It isn&rsquo;t a good time to do that, dear.&rdquo;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>根据句意，shake her head 为后一句的伴随状语，<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>Shake 应改为Shaking<br />\r\n		2. It&rsquo;s like going to a huge library without have to walk around to find.<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>without是介词，后面应接doing形式。&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>have 应改为having<br />\r\n		3. Having a pleasant trip and see you Friday.<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>根据句意，本句是祈使句，&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>Having应改为Have<br />\r\n		4. Soon I began to enjoy talk to myself on paper&hellip;&hellip;<br />\r\n		<strong>分析：</strong>enjoy后面跟doing形式&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n		<strong>答案：</strong>talk 应改为talking<br />\r\n		<strong>&nbsp;STEP3</strong><strong>【模拟试题】</strong>（答题时间：60分钟）<br />\r\n		<strong>一. 单项选择：</strong><br />\r\n		1. Don&rsquo;t you think the question _____ at the moment is of great importance.<br />\r\n		A. being discussed&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. discussed&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. to be discussed&nbsp; D. to discuss<br />\r\n		2. The food _____ at the moment is for the dinner party.<br />\r\n		A. cooked&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. to be cooked&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n		C. is being cooked&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. being cooked<br />\r\n		3 . When asked by the police, he said that he remembered ___ at the party, but not ____.<br />\r\n		A. to arrive; leaving&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. to arrive; to leave&nbsp;<br />\r\n		C. arriving; leaving&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; D. arriving; to leave<br />\r\n		4. I really appreciate ____ to relax with you on this island.<br />\r\n		A. to have had time&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. having time&nbsp; C. to have time&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. to having time<br />\r\n		5. Mr. Reed made up his mind to devote all he had to _&nbsp;&nbsp; _ some schools for poor children.<br />\r\n		A. set up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. setting up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. have set up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. having set up<br />\r\n		6. The man insist ____ a taxi for me even though I told him I lived nearby.<br />\r\n		A. find&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. to find&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. on finding&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. in finding<br />\r\n		7. There&rsquo;s a man at the reception desk who seems very angry and I think he means __ trouble.<br />\r\n		A. making&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. to make&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. to have made&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. having made<br />\r\n		8. As I will be away for at least a year, I&rsquo;d appreciate ____ from you now and then ___ me how everyone is getting along.<br />\r\n		&nbsp;&nbsp; A. hearing; tell&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. to hear; tellC. hearing; telling D. to hear; to tell<br />\r\n		<strong>二. 完型填空：</strong><br />\r\n		More than forty thousand readers told us what they looked for in close friendship, what they expected<u>&nbsp;&nbsp; 1 </u>friends, what they were willing to give in <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;2 </u>, and how satisfied they were <u>&nbsp;3&nbsp; </u>the quality of their friendships. The <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;4&nbsp; </u>give little comfort to social critics . Friendship <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;5&nbsp; </u>to be a different form of <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;6&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;relationships. Unlike marriage or the ties that <u>&nbsp;7&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;parents and children, it is not explained or regulated by <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;8&nbsp; </u>. Unlike other social roles that we are expected to <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;9 </u>&ndash;as citizens, employees, members of professional societies and <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;10&nbsp; </u>organizations &ndash;it has its own rule, which is to develop <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;11&nbsp; </u>of warmth, trust and love <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;12&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;two people.&nbsp; The <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;13&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;on friendships appeared in Psychology Today in March. The findings <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;14 </u>&nbsp;that topics of trust and betrayal are <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;15&nbsp; </u>to friendship. They also suggest that our readers do not <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;16&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;for friends only among those who are<u>&nbsp;&nbsp; 17&nbsp;&nbsp; </u>like them, but find many <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;18&nbsp; </u>differ in race, religion, and background. Arguably the most important&nbsp; <u>&nbsp;19&nbsp; </u>that appears in the article, <u>&nbsp;&nbsp;20&nbsp; </u>&nbsp;, is not something that we found--but what we did not.<br />\r\n		1. A. on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. for<br />\r\n		&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;2. A. warn&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. believe&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. prove&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. solve<br />\r\n		&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;15. A. ask&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. call&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. care&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; D. look<br />\r\n		17. A. most&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. more&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. least&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. less<br />\r\n		18. A. people&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. who&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; C. what&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. friends<br />\r\n		19. A. conclusion&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. summary&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. decision&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. demand<br />\r\n		20. A. moreover&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. however&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. still&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. yet<br />\r\n		<strong>三. 阅读理解：</strong><br />\r\n		We are all familiar with domestic trade. When I buy Florida oranges or California shirts, I naturally want to pay in dollars. Luckily. the orange grower and the shirt manufacturer are willing to accept U.S. dollars for their expenses. Trade can be carried on in dollars. Economic transactions within a country are relatively simple.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n		If I want to buy a British bicycle, however, matters become more complicated. I must ultimately pay in British money, or &quot;British pounds,&rdquo; rather than in dollars. Similarly, if the British want to buy U.S. merchandise, they must obtain U. S. dollars. And the requirement to obtain foreign currencies bolds for other countries as well.<br />\r\n		We see, then, that international trade introduces a new element: the foreign exchange rate, which denotes the price of a foreign country&#39;s currency in terms of our own.<br />\r\n		Here are some examples: The U. S. dollar price of a British pound was recently $ I. 80; for a British resident wanting to buy U. S. goods, the price of a dollar was &#8356;1/$1.80= &#8356;0.56. There is also a foreign exchange rate between U. S. dollars and the currency of each and every country, In mid&mdash;1988, the foreign exchange rate was 60 cents for a German mark, 18 cents for a French franc, 80 cents for a Canadian dollar, and 0. 8 cent for a Japanese yen. For foreigners desiring to buy dollars, the reciprocal prices were 1. 67 German marks. 5. 56 French francs, 1.25 Canadian dollars, or 125 Japanese yen for each U.S. dollar.<br />\r\n		Given the foreign exchange rate, it is now possible for me to buy my English bicycle. Suppose its quoted price is , &#8356;100（i.e. , 100 British pounds）. All I have to do is look in the newspaper for the foreign exchange rate for pounds. If this is $1.80 per pound, I simply go to a bank with $180 and ask that the money be used to pay the English bicycle exporter. Pay with what? The bank pays with pounds, of course, the kind of money the exporter needs.<br />\r\n		You should be able to show what British importers of American grain have to do if they want to buy, say a&nbsp; $ 36,000 shipment from an American exporter. Here pounds must be converted into dollars. You will see that, when the foreign exchange rate is $1.80 per pound, the grain shipment costs them &#8356;20,000.<br />\r\n		Businesses and tourists do not have to know anything more than this for their import or export transactions. But the true economics of foreign exchange rates cannot be grasped until we find out why the foreign exchange rate is at a given level.<br />\r\n		1. It can be inferred that the writer is &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;.<br />\r\n		A. British.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; B. American.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. Chinese.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. French.<br />\r\n		2. What is meant by the third paragraph?<br />\r\n		A. The foreign exchange rate is an element coming with international trade dealing with foreign countries&rsquo; currency.<br />\r\n		B. International trade introduces the clement of the foreign exchange rate indicating a foreign currency at our own price<br />\r\n		C. The foreign exchange rate is a new element in international trade indicating the price of a country&#39;s currency in terms of the price of another country&#39;s currency.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n		D. The foreign exchange rate is an element introduced to denote the price of a foreign currency in terms of the price of another foreign currency.<br />\r\n		3. In mid&mdash;1988, how much dollars did one have to have in order to exchange for 10,000,000 Japanese yen?<br />\r\n		A. 8,000,000&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; B. 80,000&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. 800,000&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. 80,000,000<br />\r\n		4. What do British importers have to do if they want to buy $ 36,000 worth of grain from an American exporter?<br />\r\n		A. They have to pay British pounds directly.<br />\r\n		B. They have to pay French francs.<br />\r\n		C. They have to convert 36,000 U.S. dollars into 20,000 British pounds.<br />\r\n		D. They have to convert 20,000 British pounds into 36,000 U.S. dollars.<br />\r\n		5. The last paragraph implies that businesses and tourists<br />\r\n		A. do not have to know the true economies of foreign exchange rates.<br />\r\n		B. do not have to know more the true economics of foreign exchange rates.<br />\r\n		C. have to know nothing more than economics of foreign exchange rates.<br />\r\n		D. do not have to grasp the true economics of foreign exchange rates at a given level.<br />\r\n		&nbsp;<br />\r\n		&nbsp;<br />\r\n		<br />\r\n		<br />\r\n		&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n	<br />\r\n	<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">&nbsp;</span></div>\r\n<br />\r\n<br />\r\n','','','221.1.213.194');

by us.<br />\r\n		从詹姆斯的脸上，我能看出他非常恐慌，生怕被我们遗弃。<br />\r\n		He abandoned his wife and children.<br />\r\n		他抛弃了他的妻子和孩子。<br />\r\n		此处abandon的意思是&ldquo;放弃，抛弃&rdquo;，相关短语有：<br />\r\n		(1)背弃祖国/朋友：abandon one&#39;s country/friend<br />\r\n		(2)抛弃家庭：abandon one&#39;s family　<br />\r\n		(3)革除陋习：abandon a bad habit<br />\r\n		(4)放弃职位/希望/计划/主意：abandon one&#39;s post/hope/plan/idea<br />\r\n		11．help The escaped prisoner was _____________ (拉) out of the cave.<br />\r\n25. Gina&#39;s ____________ (语言) is so sharp that it will get her into trouble one day.<br />\r\n26. He told us some amusing _________ (轶事) of the President&#39;s childhood.<br />\r\n27. They had an ____________ (令人敬畏的) task ahead.<br />\r\n28. Human brains contain more than 100 million __________ (细胞) per cubic (立方) centimeter.<br />\r\n三&nbsp; 单句翻译<br />\r\n&nbsp; 1．我希望上医学院，这期间，我打算学化学。(in the meantime)<br />\r\n&nbsp; 2．他突然意识到他对英语的了解相当肤浅。(be aware，shallow)<br />\r\n&nbsp; 3．我们有可能提前完成这项任务。(ahead)<br />\r\n&nbsp; 4．喜欢坐哪儿，就坐哪儿。(where)<br />\r\n&nbsp; 5．她们突然意识到有些人在瞧着这她们<br />\r\n&nbsp; 6．许多报纸都反映了儿童们的看法。<br />\r\n&nbsp; 7．纯粹是偶然机会, 他在一家小书店看到这本他所需要的稀有的书。<br />\r\n8．为什么他总是逃避责任呢？<br />\r\n9． 窃贼把屋子翻了个底朝天。（乱七八糟）<br />\r\n10． 深圳是中国南海岸的一座城市。<br />\r\n<strong>SECTION II&nbsp; &nbsp;PRACTICE</strong><br />\r\n一 单项选择<br />\r\n1. ---What did she say?&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ---Oh, nothing ________. She only wanted me to give a hand.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. in short&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. in fun&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. in special&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. in particular<br />\r\n2. My friend David was not used _______ by air, so he felt unwell(不舒服).<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. to traveling&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. to travel&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. traveling&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. travel<br />\r\n3. ______ the workers&rsquo; working conditions, the boss will allow them to have a coffee break.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. To improve&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. Having improved&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. Improved<br />\r\n4. ---Did the little boy manage _____ the suitcase upstairs?<br />\r\n&nbsp; ---No, he didn&rsquo;t. he isn&rsquo;t strong enough even ______ it.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. to carry, moving&nbsp;&nbsp; B. carrying, to move&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. to carry, to move&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. carrying, moving<br />\r\n5. After some time in the dark cave, out eyes slowly _____ the dark.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. used to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. adapted to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. accustomed to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. helped to<br />\r\n6. His physical disability makes _____ rather difficult for him to find a good job.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. him &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. that&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. this&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. it<br />\r\n7. His mother suggested he ______ to see the doctor, because his pale face suggested he ____ ill.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. would go, had been &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. go, was&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. went, had been &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. must go, was<br />\r\n8. I missed meeting my boss at the airport because my car was ______ in the traffic jam.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. broken up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. kept away&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. held up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. kept up<br />\r\n10. While shopping, people sometimes can&rsquo;t help ______ into buying something they don&rsquo;t really need.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. to persuade&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. persuading&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. being persuaded&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. be persuaded<br />\r\n二 完形填空<br />\r\nNot long ago, the only time you could see a robot was when you were reading a novel or watching a movie such as <em>Star Wars</em>. Today, _1_, a lot of things in science stories have been science facts. Robots are starting to _2_ in our everyday lives. These robots have different sizes, shapes and colors. But they all have the same _3_ of man-made &ldquo;_4_&rdquo;. Leading the robot revolution(革命) are industrial robots that work in factories. Industrial robots can do different kinds of jobs that are often _5_ and sometimes dangerous. Robots are also coming to American homes, though not as quickly as they are entering _6_. These robots aren&rsquo;t as friendly and _7_ as those you saw in <em>Star Wars</em>. But, their makers say, today&rsquo;s home robots &ldquo;walk&rdquo; and sense objects in their own way. They even _8_ objects though they may sometimes drop. Well, nobody is _9_.<br />\r\nWe may _10_ home robots today, but some day they may see and hear _11_ than humans do. We _12_ can only see certain wave lengths of light and hear certain _13_. That&rsquo;s because the _14_ of our eyes and ears are _15_. Robots, however, need not have the same limits _16_ we have. Robots may also be _17_ with devices(装置) that _18_ information humans can&rsquo;t. However, to understand _19_ their sensing devices pick up is a hard job. Remember, man-made brains _20_ information, including all kinds of data, as zeroes and ones. Imagine the difficulty in trying to explain to a robot what a football looks like---using only zeroes and ones.<br />\r\n1. A. however&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. whenever&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. on the other hand&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. in other words<br />\r\n2. A. given&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. equipped&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. sent&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. applied<br />\r\n18. A. pick out&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. pick up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. send up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. send out<br />\r\n19. A. how&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. where&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. what&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. which<br />\r\n20. A. deal&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. handle&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; C. seek &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. provide<br />\r\n三 阅读理解<br />\r\n<strong>A</strong><br />\r\nDuring an exhibition show the skills of disabled people, an armless man used his mouth and feet to repair a watch. He completed the task in just a few minutes at the show, which was held in Beijing last Saturday. Just imagine the tiny parts that make up a watch. You have to wonder how the disabled man developed such a skill.<br />\r\nIt was reported that 28-year-old Wang Jianghai lost his arms in an accident when he was five and began learning to repair watches at the age of 17. He has repaired more than 10,000 watches in the past 11 years.<br />\r\nWhat strong self-confidence he must have to overcome the difficulties in getting this skill! What optimism he must have to face the unfairness of his hard life! And what strong determination he must have to go through the hardship in his struggle for a normal life! Such confidence, optimism and willpower are exactly the qualities many physically healthy people lack nowadays. Wang has set a good example for young people.<br />\r\nBut today&#39;s youth seem to be more interested with their TV stars and pop singers but less interested in learning from the examples of working and studying hard to achieve higher goals. . That is undoubtedly the result of the influence of a changing social atmosphere. One must admit that there is a trend towards <u>hedonism</u> in our society. People are increasingly more concerned about material gains than about spiritual pursuits. While adults know they must work hard whatever way they choose to materialize the gains, the younger generation are more likely to seek ease and comforts of their senses.<br />\r\nThis pleasure-seeking trend provides a huge market for the entertainment industry and the mass media. The media devote excessive too much coverage to anecdotes of pop and TV stars, which in turn fans wider and stronger enthusiasm for entertainment among the public, especially young people.<br />\r\nOurs is a developing country. Global competition in the growth of national strength presents a demand for China to be quicker in its development. We cannot afford to lose time. We need to make our economy more powerful. To meet this need, all of us should maintain our tradition of working hard and overcoming difficulties.<br />\r\n1. A particular mention made of Wang Jianghai&rsquo;s story in the first two paragraphs _____.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. serves as a description of the trend today&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. serves as an introduction to the discussion<br />\r\n&nbsp; C. shows a disagreement of views&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. show the popularity of the TV stars and pop singers<br />\r\n2. Which of the following is the reason for young people&rsquo;s increasing interest in entertainment?<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. Young people are taught by adults to seek pleasure of senses.<br />\r\n&nbsp; B. Young people have given up our traditional value of hard working completely<br />\r\n&nbsp; C. Young people are not interested in learning from the examples of hard working at all.<br />\r\n&nbsp; D. Young people are far too much influenced by too much entertainment news in media.<br />\r\n3. The underlined word &ldquo;hedonism&rdquo; (paragraph 4) means &ldquo;________&rdquo;.<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. a material&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. spiritual gains&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\nC. thinking pleasure is the most important&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. amusement<br />\r\n<strong>B</strong><br />\r\nEvery artist knows in his heart that he is saying something to the public. Not only does he want to say it well, but he wants it to be something which has not been said before. He hopes the public will listen and understand-he wants to teach them, and he wan to them to learn from him.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; What visual artists like painters want to teach is easy to make out but difficult to explain, because translate their experiences into shapes and colors, not word. They seem to fell that a certain selection of shapes and colors, out of the countless billions possible, is exceptionally interesting for them and worth showing to us. Without their work we should never have noticed these particular shapes and colors, or have felt the delight which they brought to the artist.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Most artists take their shapes and colors from the world of nature and from human bodies in motion and response: their choices indicate that these aspects of the world are worth looking at, that they contain beautiful sights. Contemporary artists might say that they merely choose subjects that provide an interesting pattern, that there is noting more in it. Yet even they do not choose entirely without reference to the character of their subjects.<br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; If one painter chooses to paint a decaying(腐烂的) leg and another a lake in moonlight, each of them is directing our attention to a certain aspect of the world. Each painter is telling us something, showing us something, emphasizing something&mdash;all of which means that, consciously or unconsciously, he is trying to teach us.<br />\r\n4. It is hard to understand a painting because_____<br />\r\n&nbsp; A. the artist wants to teach the others&nbsp;<br />\r\nB. a painter uses shapes and colors instead of works.<br />\r\nC. the painter doesn&rsquo;t express his idea well enough<br />\r\nD. the painting is meaningless<br />\r\n5. A painter uses certain shapes and colors because he feels that they ____.<br />\r\nA. haven&rsquo;t been used before &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. are worth showing to the public<br />\r\nC. are interesting to them &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. haven&rsquo;t been noticed by the public<br />\r\n6 Implied but not stated_____.<br />\r\nA. paintings are more easily understood than music.<br />\r\nB. to find what the artist is saying we must look beyond the shape and color<br />\r\nC. painting is only the arranging of shape and color<br />\r\nD. all artists are trying to teach something to the public<br />\r\n7. Why do painters want to teach is easy to make out but difficult to explain?<br />\r\nA. Because painters cannot express themselves clearly in words.<br />\r\nB. Because painters change their into shapes and colors, not words.<br />\r\nC. Because people cannot understand painters&rsquo; words.<br />\r\nD. Because people are not interested in what painters want to tell us.<br />\r\n8. Where do most artists take their shapes and colors?<br />\r\nA. From nature &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; B. From human bodies in motion and repose.<br />\r\nC. From artists&rsquo; own imagination. &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; D. Both A and B<br />\r\n四 完成句子<br />\r\n1. 每次我沮丧的时候，爸爸总是想尽办法来鼓励我。<br />\r\n&nbsp; ___________________ I feel depressed, my father will try his best to ___________ me.<br />\r\n2. 我发现花大量的时间去照顾宠物是值得的。<br />\r\n&nbsp; I find ___________________ taking a lot of time to look after my pets.<br />\r\n3. 接受他们，鼓励他们和你一样过一种丰富多彩，充实的生活。<br />\r\n&nbsp; Just _________ them for who they are, and give them encouragement to live _____________________ as you do.<br />\r\n4. 有一段时间，智障儿童在很多方面不能过一种正常的生活。<br />\r\n&nbsp; There was a time when children with mental disabilities were prevented from ____________________ in many ways.<br />\r\n5. 尽管托尼当时在隔壁房间，他还是及时赶过来把她接住了。<br />\r\n&nbsp; _____________ Tony was in the next room, he __________________ catch her in time.<br />\r\n6. 和任何事情一样，你练习的越多，你就变得越好。<br />\r\n&nbsp; As with anything, _____________ you practice, _________________ you become.<br />\r\n7. 在星期一的下午，我正要回家，王Sir打电话让我完成一项任务。<br />\r\n&nbsp; ____________ the afternoon of Monday, I ________________ go home when Mr. Wang called me and asked me to finish a task.<br />\r\n8. 站在船头的人把鱼叉瞄准了那头鲸，正好射中要害，鲸受伤很严重，不久就死了。<br />\r\n&nbsp; The man in the bow of the boat _________ the harpoon ________ the whale and hit the spot, ____________________, the whale soon died.<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n参考答案：<br />\r\nSECTION I LANGUAGE POINTS<br />\r\n1. bring in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 2. in the distance&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 3. help out&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 4. a pack of&nbsp; 5. be about to do sth.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 6. be scared to death&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 7. reflect on&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />\r\n8. be/ become aware of/ that&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 9. in the meantime&nbsp;&nbsp; 10. upside down&nbsp; 11. was aware of&nbsp;&nbsp; 12. in the meantime&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 13. upside down<br />\r\n14. in the distance&nbsp;&nbsp; 15. A pack of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 16. ahead of&nbsp;&nbsp; 17. bring in&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 18. was scared to death<br />\r\n单词拼写<br />\r\n1. reflect&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 2. narrow&nbsp;&nbsp; 3. pure&nbsp;&nbsp; 4. yelled&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; 5. annual&nbsp;&nbsp; 6. dragged&nbsp;&nbsp; 7. tongue&nbsp;&nbsp; 8. anecdotes&nbsp;&nbsp; 9. awesome&nbsp;&nbsp; 10. cells<br />\r\n第四节 单句翻译<br />\r\n1．I hope to go to medical college. In the meantime, I am going to study chemistry.<br />\r\n2. He was suddenly aware of his shallow English.或 He was suddenly aware that his English was shallow.<br />\r\n3. We are likely to finish the task ahead of time. 或 It is possible that we can finish the task ahead of time.<br />\r\n4. Please sit where you like.&nbsp; 50. They suddenly became aware of people looking at them.<br />\r\n5. Many newspapers reflect the opinions of the children.&nbsp; 52. By pure chance he found the rare book he needed in a little shop.<br />\r\n6. Why does he always flee any kind of responsibility?&nbsp; 54. The burglars had turned the house inside out.<br />\r\n7. Shenzhen is a city on the south coast of Ireland.<br />\r\nSECTION II PRACTICE<br />\r\n单项：DABCB&nbsp; DBDCC&nbsp;<br />\r\n完形：ABDCB&nbsp; BCADC&nbsp; CBCDC&nbsp; ABBCB<br />\r\n阅读: BDC&nbsp; BCBBD<br />\r\n完成句子<br />\r\n1. Every time, encourage&nbsp; 2, it worth/worthwhile&nbsp; 3, accept, as rich and full a life<br />\r\n4. living a normal life&nbsp; 5, Even though, managed to&nbsp; 6. the more, the better<br />\r\n7, On, was about to&nbsp; 8. aimed at, Being badly wounded</span><br />\r\n','','','221.1.213.194');
INSERT INTO `dede_cwez_addonarticle` VALUES('981','37','<span style=\"font-size: 16px\"><strong>Teaching aims:</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; 1. Let students know about the usage of words and expressions.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp; 2. encourage students to make sentences with them.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>1. hear from ... </strong><strong>意为</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>收到</strong><strong>&hellip;&hellip;</strong><strong>的信</strong><strong>&rdquo;, </strong><strong>相当于</strong><strong>receive a letter from ... </strong><strong>。</strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>如：</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; I hear from my mother every week.&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>每星期我都收到妈妈的信。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>[</strong><strong>比较</strong><strong>] hear from</strong><strong>和</strong><strong>receive</strong><strong>都可表示</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>收到某人的信</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><strong>。其区别如下：</strong><br />\r\n<strong>hear from</strong><strong>不是指具体接到信件</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>而是指得到音信、信息</strong><strong>; receive</strong><strong>往往指收到具体的信件。如：</strong><br />\r\n<strong>I haven&rsquo;t heard from him for a long time. </strong><strong>我好久没得到他的音信了。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>I haven&rsquo;t received any letters from him for several months. </strong><br />\r\n<strong>我已经好几个月没有收到他的信了。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>2. I know you&rsquo;re dying to hear all about my life here, so I</strong><strong>&rsquo;</strong><strong>ve included some photos which will help you picture the places I talk about.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>我知道你极想听到我在这儿的生活</strong><strong>,</strong><strong>我这儿有一些照片</strong><strong>,</strong><strong>它们会帮你构思出我要谈到的这个地方。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>1) be dying for/ to do sth.&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong><strong>渴望</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>极想</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>渴望做某事</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; After a long dry season the trees are dying / thirsty for water.</strong><strong>?</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Nowadays there are more and more students dying to study abroad.</strong><strong>?</strong><br />\r\n<strong>2) </strong><strong>辨析</strong><strong>: hear </strong><strong>与</strong><strong> listen to</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; hear&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>强调听的结果</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; listen to&nbsp; </strong><strong>强调听的动作</strong><br />\r\n<strong>由动词</strong><strong>die</strong><strong>构成的短语：</strong><br />\r\n<strong>die away</strong><strong>逐渐消失</strong><br />\r\n<strong>die down</strong><strong>逐渐模糊</strong><br />\r\n<strong>die off </strong><strong>相继死去</strong><br />\r\n<strong>die out</strong><strong>逐渐消失</strong><br />\r\n<strong>3. I&rsquo;ve included some photos which will help you picture the places I talk about. </strong><strong>我在信中附了几张照片</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>可以帮助你想象出我所谈到的地方。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; picture <em>n.</em> </strong><strong>图画</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>照片</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>画面</strong><strong><em>vt.</em></strong> <strong>描绘</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>想象</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; She often pictures herself as a famous writer. </strong><strong>她常常想象自己是个名作家。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>4. Well, it&rsquo;s a bush school&mdash;the classroom are made of bamboo and the roofs of grass.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>是的</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>这是一所灌木丛学校</strong><strong>---</strong><strong>教室是由竹子建成的</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>房顶是用草盖的。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>make</strong><strong>的用法：</strong><br />\r\n<strong>1) be made from </strong><strong>由</strong><strong>......</strong><strong>制成</strong><strong> (</strong><strong>看不出原材料</strong><strong>)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The paper is made from wood.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>2) be made of </strong><strong>由</strong><strong>......</strong><strong>制成</strong><strong>(</strong><strong>看出原材料</strong><strong>)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The house is made of stone.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>3) be made into&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>某种原材料制制成某种成品</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Glasses is made into bottles.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>4) be made in </strong><strong>在某地制造</strong><strong>, in</strong><strong>后面接表示地点的名词</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; This TV set is made in <em>Shanghai</em></strong><br />\r\n<strong>5) be made by </strong><strong>由谁制造</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The machine is made by workers in the factory.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>6) be made up of </strong><strong>由</strong><strong>......</strong><strong>组成</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The class is made of 30 boys and 30 girls.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>5. The boys who had never come across anything like this before started jumping out of the windows.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; come across </strong><strong>偶然遇见</strong><strong>/</strong><strong>发现</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>与</strong><strong>come</strong><strong>相关的短语：</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; come along&nbsp; </strong><strong>快点</strong><strong>,</strong><strong>来吧</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp; come back</strong><strong>　回来</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>折回</strong><br />\r\n<strong>come from&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>来自</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>从</strong><strong>&hellip;&hellip;</strong><strong>来</strong><br />\r\n<strong>come off&nbsp; </strong><strong>　从</strong><strong>&hellip;&hellip;</strong><strong>离开</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>脱落</strong><br />\r\n<strong>come out&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>出来</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>出版</strong><br />\r\n<strong>come up&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>走过来</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>走近</strong><br />\r\n<strong>come over&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>过来</strong><br />\r\n<strong>come to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>来到</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>结果是</strong><br />\r\n<strong>6. But last weekend another teacher, Jenny, and I did visit a village which is the home of one of the boys, Tombe. </strong><strong>但是上周末</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>另一位老师</strong><strong>Jenny</strong><strong>和我拜访了一个村子</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>这个村子是其中一个男孩</strong><strong>Tombe</strong><strong>的家。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>did</strong><strong>强调肯定语气</strong><strong>, do (does, did)</strong><strong>用于强调谓语动词的语气时</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>要符合以下条件</strong><strong>:</strong><br />\r\n<strong>(1) </strong><strong>句子是肯定句</strong><strong>;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><br />\r\n<strong>(2)</strong><strong>谓语动词为一般现在时或一般过去时</strong><strong>; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong><br />\r\n<strong>(3)</strong><strong>谓语动词是单独的行为动词或单独的连系动词</strong><strong>(be</strong><strong>除外</strong><strong>)</strong><strong>。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>The little girl does want to see her mother.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>这个女孩非常想见她的母亲。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>I do like to eat apples.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</strong><strong>我的确喜欢吃苹果。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>Do stay a while.&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><strong>请待会儿。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>撒谎吧。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>7. adjust <em>vt. &amp; vi.</em> </strong><strong>调整</strong><strong>; </strong><strong>调节</strong><strong>; </strong><strong>适应</strong><strong>; </strong><strong>整理</strong><strong>; </strong><strong>调准。如：</strong><br />\r\n<strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The body can quickly adjust itself to the changes of temperature.&nbsp; </strong><strong>身体能迅速自行调节以适应气温的变化。</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>区别</strong><strong>adapt, adjust, fit, suit, match</strong><strong>这几个词</strong><br />\r\n<strong>都含</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>适合、适应</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><strong>的意思。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>1) adapt </strong><strong>指</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>修改或改变以适应新条件</strong><strong>&rdquo;<br />\r\nYou should adapt yourself to the new </strong><br />\r\n<strong>2) adjust </strong><strong>指</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>调整、调节</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><strong>使之适应</strong><br />\r\n<strong>3) fit </strong><strong>多指</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>大小适合</strong><strong>&rdquo;, </strong><strong>引伸为</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>吻合</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><br />\r\n<strong>4) suit </strong><strong>多指</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>合乎要求、口味、性格、情况</strong><strong>&rdquo; </strong><br />\r\n<strong>5) match </strong><strong>指</strong><strong>&ldquo;</strong><strong>大小、色调、形状、性质等相配或相称</strong><strong>&rdquo;</strong><br />\r\n<strong><em>练习题</em></strong><br />\r\n<strong>I.</strong> <strong>根据下列各句句意及所给单词的首字母或汉语提示，写出各单词的正确形式。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>1. As a teacher I often a_____ my teaching methods to suit the needs of slower children.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>2. My mother stood in the ________ (</strong><strong>门口</strong><strong>) and watched me anxiously</strong><br />\r\n<strong>3. It is hoped that education should be _______ (</strong><strong>有关的</strong><strong>) to children&rsquo;s needs.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>4. The train for Beijing that you are taking will depart from P_______4.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>5. I will go to the store to buy some _____ (</strong><strong>烤架</strong><strong>) for the picnic next week.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>6. Some old workers enjoy certain p________, such as company cars and private health care in our company.</strong><br />\r\n<strong>II. </strong><strong>根据括号内的提示将下列句子翻译成</strong><br />\r\n&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>英语。</strong><br />\r\n<strong>1. </strong><strong>自从我表弟出国后</strong><strong>,</strong><strong>我一直没有收到他的信。</strong><strong>(hear from)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>2. </strong><strong>回家的路上我们碰见一位老妇人躺在路上。</strong><strong>(come across)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>3. </strong><strong>她的红头发在人群中非常显眼。</strong><strong>(stick out)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>4. </strong><strong>离家很久了</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>这个女孩很想见到自己的妈妈</strong><strong>, </strong><strong>特别是在她生病的时候。</strong><strong>(be dying to)</strong><br />\r\n<strong>5. </strong><strong>那个男孩兴奋地向他父母描述他第一天在学校的情况。</strong><strong>(picture)</strong><br />\r\n<strong><em>反思</em></strong>：单词和短语的学习比较枯燥，把单词和短语运用到比较有趣的句子，通过句子记单词。最好配备相关的图片，印象深刻。</span><br />\r\n','','','221.1.213.194');
INSERT INTO `dede_cwez_addonarticle` VALUES('982','37','<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">一、Teaching goals教学目标<br />\r\n1. Target language语言目标<br />\r\na. 重点词汇和短语<br />\r\nrelevant, doorway, adjust, platform, soft, softly, grill, privilege, hear from, be dying to, up to, adapt to, for sure, the other day, come across, make a difference, shake hands with, get through, stick out, dry out, dry up, even though<br />\r\nb. 重点句子<br />\r\n&nbsp;&hellip;I&rsquo;ve included some photos which will help you picture the places I talk about. P29<br />\r\nThe other day I was showing the boys the weekly chemistry experiment when, before I knew it, the mixture was bubbling over every where. P29<br />\r\nWe walked for two and a half hours to get there &mdash; first up a mountain to a ridge from where we had fantastic views and then down a steep path to the valley below. P29<br />\r\n2. Ability goal能力目标<br />\r\nEnable the students to learn about PNG and Jo&rsquo;s work in PNG as a volunteer teacher.<br />\r\n3. Learning ability goal 学能目标<br />\r\nHelp the students learn how to read between lines and find the positive and negative aspects of doing something.<br />\r\n二、Teaching important and difficult points 教学重难点<br />\r\nHelp the students read between lines and comprehend the passage completely by knowing logical relations between facts and reasons.<br />\r\n三、Teaching methods 教学方法<br />\r\nSkimming, scanning and task-based method.<br />\r\n四、Teaching aids 教具工具<br />\r\nA recorder, a projector and ppt.&nbsp;<br />\r\n五、Teaching procedures &amp; ways教学过程与方式<br />\r\n<strong>Step </strong><strong>Ⅰ</strong><strong> Pre-reading</strong><br />\r\nT: I told you to google for information about PNG. Some questions for you. Who knows what PNG stands for?<br />\r\nSa: PNG stands for Papua New Guinea.<br />\r\nT: Where is it located?<br />\r\nSb: It is located south of the equator, 160km north of Australia.<br />\r\nT: Who can say something about its history?<br />\r\nSc: &hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;<br />\r\nSd: &hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;&hellip;.<br />\r\nT: Thank you for your wonderful information. Actually, there are already some volunteers there. Let&rsquo;s get to know one of them, Jo. First let&rsquo;s look at the pictures on Pages 29-30.<br />\r\n<strong>Step </strong><strong>Ⅱ</strong><strong> Reading comprehending </strong><br />\r\n<strong>Skimming</strong><br />\r\nT: Now read the letter and try to get the general idea of it. Try to divide it into four parts, and summarize what each part is about.<br />\r\nPart 1 (Para 1): Opening of the letter and introduction to what will be talked about in the passage.<br />\r\nPart 2 (Para 2-3): The school where Jo worked and Jo&rsquo;s work at the school.<br />\r\nPart 3 (Para 4-8): Jo and Jenny visited Tombe&rsquo;s home in the village.<br />\r\nPart 4 (Para 9): Closing of the letter.<br />\r\n&nbsp;<br />\r\n<strong>Reading carefully</strong><br />\r\nT: Now you&rsquo;re to read the passage carefully to complete the tables below! Five minutes for you.<br />\r\nTable 1 (about the school)</span><br />\r\n<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\">\r\n	<tbody>\r\n		<tr>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span 16px\">Equipped</span></td>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span style=\"font-size: 16px\">Not equipped</span></td>\r\n		</tr>\r\n		<tr>\r\n			<td style=\"width: 189px\">\r\n				<span
